column4: I'm guessing linux is too big to get an installer on a diskette, in that case, should I shoot for Dapper? or ??? Your naming convention is out to lunch.
you can order a free CD at ubuntu.com

Takes too long, and it's generally cheaper to just netinstall. I am playing with openbsd right now, and I am happy with it, except for the lack of drivers (Both my Vortex soundcard AND Aureal 802.11G NIC)
